oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Results of routine testing of organic food for agro-chemical residues
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lo, Ming
Matthews, Dave
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Food systems
Quality and evaluation of inputs
Consumer issues
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This report was presented at the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference. Consumers expect organic foods to be free of agro-chemical residues. Organix Brands plc. routinely test organic food ingredients for agrochemical residues using independent test laboratories. In the past year 243 batches of ingredients were tested and low levels of agro-chemical residues were found in 21% of samples. These residues can arise in organic food through environmental contamination, processing contamination or even the fraudulent use of agro-chemicals on organic food. Food containing agro-chemical residues can enter the organic system because of limitations in the organic rules
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lo, Ming and Matthews, Dave (2002) Results of routine testing of organic food for agro-chemical residues. In: Powell, Jane and et al., (Eds.) Proceedings of the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference, Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth, pp. 61-64.
